abstract_summ: We optimized a fluorescent quantitative polymerase chain reaction (qPCR) assay system for rapid and real time detection of SARS-CoV-2 RNA.Our work provides a tool to facilitate rapid clinical diagnosis of COVID-19.The SARS-CoV-2 pandemic has evolved far more aggressively in countries lacking a robust testing strategy to identify infected individuals.In addition, we isolated RNA from SARS-CoV-2 infected patients and achieved similar results to clinical RT-qPCR assays.Here, we present a new ultra-fast test method which is ten times faster than conventional diagnostic tests using real time quantitative PCR (RT-qPCR).Therefore, this simple protocol allows SARS-CoV-2 testing independently of commercial kit providers in a time and cost-effective manner.
title_summ: Fast SARS-CoV-2 detection by RT-qPCR in preheated nasopharyngeal swab samples.[Optimization of a fluorescent qPCR detection for RNA of SARS-CoV-2].Fast SARS-CoV-2 detection protocol based on RNA precipitation and RT-qPCR in nasopharyngeal swab samplesSARS-CoV-2 On-the-Spot Virus Detection Directly From PatientsUltra-fast one-step RT-PCR protocol for the detection of SARS-CoV-2Detection of SARS-CoV-2 RNA by multiplex RT-qPCR
title_abstract_phrases: Our work provides a tool to facilitate rapid clinical diagnosis of COVID-19.Fast SARS-CoV-2 detection protocol based on RNA precipitation and RT-qPCR in nasopharyngeal swab samplesThe SARS-CoV-2 pandemic has evolved far more aggressively in countries lacking a robust testing strategy to identify infected individuals.CONCLUSIONS Our findings provide valuable options to overcome any supply chain issue and help to increase the throughput of diagnostic tests, thereby complementing standard diagnosis.[Optimization of a fluorescent qPCR detection for RNA of SARS-CoV-2].We optimized a fluorescent quantitative polymerase chain reaction (qPCR) assay system for rapid and real time detection of SARS-CoV-2 RNA.Fast SARS-CoV-2 detection by RT-qPCR in preheated nasopharyngeal swab samples.Here, we could show correlation between the results obtained by NEXTGENPCR and conventional RT-qPCR.Detection of SARS-CoV-2 RNA by multiplex RT-qPCRThe current RT-qPCR assay recommended for SARS-CoV-2 testing in the United States requires analysis of three genomic targets per sample: two viral and one host.The results show that the lowest dilution of RNA samples used for the detection of SARS-CoV-2 RNA could reach 1/10 000 (the initial value is set as 10 ng/μL).
